title: Jake Gyllenhaal on "Everest": 'We Were at Risk All the Time'
text:
Share Article 
Universal (LOS ANGELES) -- The mountain climbing thriller Everest is out now, and as tense as it is for the audience, it's perhaps even more tense for one of it stars. 
Jake Gyllenhaal tells ABC Radio that Everest was his most intense shoot yet. "We were in the elements all the time, and we were at risk all the time," he explains. 
But that was part of the attraction, as sold by director Balthasar Kormakur, according to Gyllenhaal. The actor recalls, "He gathered a whole group of people who were down to take risks all the time." 
They shot on icy mountains all over the world, and deep in canyons of ice. Gyllenhaal says of his director, "He'd say, 'Go down there,' you know, and you'd be like, Can I get a rope?" 
Everest made 13.1 million dollars last weekend, its first weekend in wide release.
